text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires identifying the relevant Moral Right to the alteration of the character as the Right of Integrity (s.80 CDPA 1988). The candidate answer explicitly discusses Moral Rights, stating: \"Right to object to derogatory treatment of the work (s. 80)\" under the Moral Rights section. Furthermore, under Section 4.2, it lists the \"Right to object to derogatory treatment (s. 80) \u2013 if the altered Ophelia is presented in a way that harms your reputation (e.g., associated with a sugary drink you don\u2019t endorse).\" This directly identifies the Right of Integrity (s.80 CDPA 1988) in relation to the altered character.", "criterion_id": "07e967a4-3303-4bab-a56d-961b4b8ee3fd"}
